metadata.title: CVE-2018-14641 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description: A security flaw was found in the ip_frag_reasm() function innet/ipv4/ip_fragment.c in the Linux kernel from 4.19-rc1 to 4.19-rc3inclusive, which can cause a later system crash in ip_do_fragment(). Withcertain non-default, but non-rare, configuration of a victim host, anattacker can trigger this crash remotely, thus leading to a remotedenial-of-service.

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
